name: Penny Rimbaud
description: '''Penny Lapsang Rimbaud''' (born '''Jeremy John Ratter''', 8 June 1943) is a writer, poet, philosopher, painter, musician and activist. He was a member of the performance art groups [[EXIT (performance art group)|EXIT]] and Ceres Confusion, and in 1972 was co-founder of the [[Stonehenge Free Festival]], together with Phil Russell aka [[Wally Hope]]. In 1977 with [[Steve Ignorant]], he co-founded the seminal anarchist punk band [[Crass]] and served as its drummer. Crass disbanded in 1984. Until 2000 Rimbaud devoted himself almost entirely to writing, returning to the public platform in 2001 as a performance poet working with Australian saxophonist Louise Elliott and a wide variety of jazz musicians under the umbrella of [[Last Amendment]].
